headerSection.headerBody: Dasig is a non-profit and non-government organization founded on the compassion of friendship and the will to serve the people by offering relief or humanitarian assistance and spreading mental health awareness.
headerSection.subheader: Established by Alumni of Saint Teresa's School of Bato

aboutSection.about1:
Dasig is a Visayan word that means "to inspire, encourage, hold on."
It is something that everyone of us needs right now. In these trying
times, everyone is in constant battle, but with this simple
advocacy, we want our organization to be of help in the simplest
possible way.
aboutSection.about2:
With a fervent commitment to this simple yet powerful advocacy, our
organization seeks to extend a helping hand in the most fundamental
manner possible. We aspire to be agents of change, catalysts for
positivity, and providers of solace to those who find themselves
struggling amidst the chaos.
aboutSection.about3:
In our endeavor to make a tangible difference, we call upon the
generosity and compassion of our community. By joining hands and
pooling our resources, we can reach out to those who remain unseen
and unheard, offering them the support and assistance they so
desperately need.
aboutSection.about4:
We humbly appeal to your benevolence to aid us in our mission. Your
contributions, no matter how modest, will serve as a lifeline for
those who are yet to be reached. Every donation, every act of
kindness, is a testament to the indomitable spirit of humanity.
Together, let us sow the seeds of Dasig, nurturing hope and
resilience in the hearts of those who need it most.

link.linkBody:
If you are in need of food, hygiene kits, cash assistance, or
clothes it is our mission to support and assist. We will give
our best to cater your needs. We have a lot of good quality
clothes that has been donated by our generous donors.

Every December or whenever there is a big project, we need
volunteers that will help us distribute the goods, organize,
collect and deliver the donations. If you are interested to join
our team, please drop a message on our Facebook page.

A monetary gift from you can save lives and help the most
vulnerable. Donations enable us to provide immediate assistance
to those people who are in need, securing financial aid with
every donation goes a long way.

teamSection.teamSubtitle: The team that made Dasig possible.

faqsSection.faqsSubtitle: Things you might want to know beforehand.

faqs.question: Is this a non-profit organization?
faqs.answer: Yes, all proceeds go towards charity.

faqs.question: I am near Bato Leyte, can I opt to meet for donation?
faqs.answer:
If you opt to donate in-kind and you are near Bato Leyte, kindly drop it at the said locations:

 P. Burgos St. Brgy. Bagongbayan Bato, Leyte (in front of Bright Star Child Information Center)
 Contact Person: John Christopher Sulla (09176393542)

 Jose Rizal St. Brgy. Tinago, Bato, Leyte (in front of Bato School of Fisheries, adjacent to Axil Graphics)
 Contact Person: Trisha Suzanne Aguilar (09178780661)

faqs.question: Can I donate through G-Cash?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you can send it through this platform.

GCash: Kareen Ann Estorba 09279521955

faqs.question: Can I donate via banking?
faqs.answer:
You may send your donation through this channel.

 PNB: Trisha Suzanne A 3051-1003-2070

footerSection.footerCopyright: Â© Copyright Dasig. All Rights Reserved
footerSection.footerPromise:
Our promise to protect the privacy and confidentiality of your
personal data. All personal data collected will be treated in
accordance to the requirements in Data Privacy Act of 2012. We
promise not to sell, share or swap your personal information with
any other company/organization. The information you provided will be
treated with utmost confidentiality, for the purpose of donation
administration, receipt issuing and communications about your
donation. Please refer to our Privacy Policy for more details.
